meanings.sent1: I twight the ribbons to make a bow.
meanings.sent2: The vines twight around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: She tried to twight her hair into a fancy braid.
meanings.sent4: The dancers twight around each other in a graceful waltz.
meanings.sent5: The spider silk twight delicately in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A small, slender twig or shoot
meanings.sent1: I found a twight on the forest floor.
meanings.sent2: The bird built its nest with twights and leaves.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the twight as a balance beam.
meanings.sent4: The twight snapped under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The twight swayed gently in the wind.

meanings.definition: A sudden, quick movement or turn
meanings.sent1: With a twight, he dodged the incoming ball.
meanings.sent2: The cat made a twight to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent3: The sudden twight of the squirrel startled me.
meanings.sent4: Her twight in the dance routine was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The twight of the fish as it leaped out of the water was mesmerizing.
